description.narrative:
Project title: Support the strengthening of local capacities to prevent and Managing crises and disasters in Dosso and Tillaberi Duration: from 1 June 2013 to May 2014 Intervention area : 12 municipalities of Dosso and Tillaberi regions in Niger. Directs beneficiaries : The direct beneficiaries are estimated at 3 715 people with at least 50% of women are members of Vulnerability Monitoring Observatory (OSV) and community early warning system and response to crises (SCAP-RU), staff and board members ofFUGPN Mooriben, members of sub regional committee for prevention and management of disasters and food crises (CSR / PGCCA), and populations of beneficiary villages micro projects. Others beneficiaries: The indirect beneficiaries are 620 471 people with50% women. It is population of pastoralists, agro pastoralists and fishermen of 12 municipalities project intervention. The project aims to improve the functioningof community and communal vulnerability monitoring and emergency response system at 12 municipalities of Niger through capacity building of key stakeholders in a sustainability perspective. The expected outcomes Four (04) main outcomes are expected from the implementation of this project 5. Outcome1: Mooriben is able to support the community and communal tracking devices vulnerability in theprevention and management of crises and disasters. This is to strengthen the capacity of Mooriben on the prevention and management of emergencies to provide qualitative support for OSV and SCAP / RUtoplay the role of international NGOs have always assured. The main activities to achieve this result are training staffs organizations on key issues related to emergencies such as humanitarian standards SPHERE, Live stock emergencies guidelines and standards (LEGS), Participatory analysis of capacity and vulnerability (APCV), logistics, finance and administration in emergency, etc. 6. Outcome 2: community early warning systems of 12 municipalities are operational, sustainable and integrated national earlywarning system. Through this, the OSV and SCAP/RU trained, equipped and accompanied by the three partners and CSR / PGCCA which they belong ensure the collection, processing, analysis and storage/dissemination of data on vulnerability. These data shouldbe used to alert beneficiaries and stakeholders in the development of different levels (local, regional, national) on the risks of crises and disasters and to enable them to act accordingly. Main activities that will help achieve this result are (i) restructuring and / or revitalization of OSV / SCAP / RU, training and equipment and support, organization of exchange visits. 7. Outcome 3 : The 12 municipalities covered by the program in Mooriben intervention area are able to manage crises and disasters Capacity of municipalities in the prevention and crisis preparedness and disaster enable them to make an analysis of disaster risk capacity and vulnerability of communities and therefore act with quality and accountability on the basis of a planning short, medium and long-term risk reduction. The participation of community stakeholders in the development and implementation ofa community pedagogical micro project beyond responding to the needs expressed by the beneficiaries of these projects. Activitiesthatsupport this outcome are (i) support the achievement of APCV at municipal level; (ii) develop contingency plans that reflect the specific needs and vulnerabilities of women and provide an appropriate response to them, (iii) support to the implementation of community micro projects to strengthen preparedness to crises and disasters.
8. Outcome 4: The national early warning system (SAP) accepts and integrates information of 24 SCAP-RU through 12 vulnerability monitoring observatories (OSV). The mainactivities of this result are (i) organize advocacy for active participation of SAP and its branches in the activities of OSV and SCAP / RU, (ii) support the operation of the Advisory Committee, (iii) support the activities of management of CSR / PGCCAcommunal structures and community, (iv) support the production of quarterly newsletters on the vulnerability at the departmental level, (v) train municipal and departmental stakeholders on charter prevention and management of food crisis.

participating-org.narrative: FUGPN (the Federation of Unions of Farmers Groups in Niger) is also known under the name Mooriben, meaning the end of misery in thelocal language Zarma. Founded in 1992, this federation of agricultural unions is one of Niger's first farmers organisations.It had five member unions with 1,848 members at the time of its foundation. Mooriben has grown into a leading organisation with 30 unions,56626 members (63% women), active in Tillabery and Dosso provinces in Niger's Southwest, in 732 villages. Mooriben is committed to the improvement of the food and income security of its members. Especially during the lean season, many members lack coping mechanisms to avoid impoverishment, debt and forced sale of their working capital. The lack of coping mechanismsmakes the members very vulnerable to distress. Food scarcity can easily turn into food crises, like in 2005, 2010, and 2012. Mooriben therefore promotes the growth of agricultural production by improved techniques, diversification of the sources of foodand income, and improvement of the farmers position in the production chain. Grain banks have proved to be an effective instrument to regulate in a collective way the purchasing and selling of individual farmers, and are further promoted. As a consequenceof the failed harvest of 2004, up from 2005 Mooriben has been involved in humanitarian interventions. For this purpose, the staff of Mooriben has built its capacities and knowledgeon humanitarian standards and on the methodology for vulnerability and needs assessment.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
